Key Match Events: Karl-Anthony Towns exploded offensively with 44 points, 16 rebounds, and five assists, but it was too little, too late as Chicago outscored the Knicks 41-17 in the third quarter.
Zach LaVine and Coby White countered the dynamic duo of Towns and Brunson by combining for 66 points.
Post-Match Reflections: Karl-Anthony Towns took charge in the final moments, determined not to lose, but his efforts ultimately fell short.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks still need to prove they can beat the NBAâ€™s best teams.
Their victories over the Bucks and Nuggets, featuring their star players, have been the highlights of the season.
Others: The Knicks have a record of 1-2 to begin the new calendar year.
They face the Orlando Magic next, who have size, defensive prowess, and scoring ability.
